title: 1867 Massachusetts gubernatorial election
added: *[[William Claflin]], Lieutenant Governor and chairman of the Republican National Committee
*[[Henry L. Dawes]], U.S. Representative from Pittsfield
*[[George B. Loring]], State Representative from Salem
*F.E. Parker{{efn|Possibly Francis E. Parker, a member of the Massachusetts Historical Society.}}
*Joseph Adams Pond, President of the Massachusetts Senate
*[[Alexander H. Rice]], U.S. Representative from Boston

There was a motion to re-nominate Bullock by acclamation, but it was rejected and withdrawn.<ref name=convention>{{cite news|title=Massachusetts: Proceedings of the Republican State Convention in Worcester|work=The New York Times|date=12 Sep 1867|p=1|url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1867/09/12/79366679.html?pageNumber=1}}</ref> Nonetheless, Bullock easily won on the first ballot against scattered opposition.
